Package mansionBandit.gameView

Interface Summary
SurfaceStrategy SurfaceStrategy handles drawing each 'surface' in the game
 

Class Summary
BackWallStrategy strategy for drawing the back wall and its items handles getting objects based on mouse coordinates
DrawnObject wrapper class to hold a game object to be drawn.
GamePanel This panel is responsible for displaying the game world It takes a Player as an argument, and renders the room that player is in.
RoomView RoomView contains all objects and information required to draw a view of a single room on the screen By default the room will be rendered as if it is directly in front of the viewer, with the viewer standing flat against the back wall.
SideWallStrategy Strategy for drawing the left and right wall, and all the objects the surface contains.
Surface a surface in a room (wall, floor, ceiling) different strategies can be passed in to the surface to determine how it is drawn (eg left wall or back wall) NOTE: Strategy pattern has become somewhat redundant due to strategies no longer being swapped around, which was the initial reason for using the design pattern
TopBottomStrategy Strategy for drawing the ceiling, and the floor, and all the objects the surface contains.
